articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Vladimir Putin has moved to prolong his repressive and unyielding grip on Russia for another six years. Putin still commands wide support after nearly a quarter-century in power, despite starting an immensely costly war in Ukraine that has taken thousands of his countrymen’s lives, provoked repeated attacks inside Russia -– including one on the Kremlin itself -– and corroded its aura of invincibility.
articles.title: Putin will seek another presidential term in Russia, extending his rule of over two decades

articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: Vladimir Putin has moved to prolong his repressive and unyielding grip on Russia for another six years. Putin still commands wide support after nearly a quarter-century in power, despite starting an immensely costly war in Ukraine that has taken thousands of his countrymen’s lives, provoked repeated attacks inside Russia -– including one on the Kremlin itself -– and corroded its aura of invincibility.
articles.title: Putin will seek another presidential term in Russia, extending his rule of over two decades

articles.author: NAJIB JOBAIN, BASSEM MROUE and ELENA BECATOROS
articles.description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — Desperate Palestinians fleeing Israel's expanding ground offensive crowded into an ever-shrinking area of the Gaza Strip as the Israel-Hamas war entered its third month Friday.
articles.title: Palestinians crowd into ever-shrinking areas in Gaza as Israel's war against Hamas enters 3rd month

articles.author: ISABEL DEBRE, SAMY MAGDY and NAJIB JOBAIN
articles.description: RAFAH, Gaza Strip (AP) — The roads are so ravaged that the dead and wounded arrive by donkey cart. Desperate relatives rush bloodied and dust-covered people, many of them children, to the hospital.
articles.title: Bloodshed, fear, hunger, desperation: Palestinians try to survive war's new chapter in southern Gaza

articles.author: LINDSAY WHITEHURST
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Hunter Biden was indicted on nine tax charges in California on Thursday as a special counsel investigation into the business dealings of President Joe Biden's son intensifies against the backdrop of the looming 2024 election.
articles.title: Hunter Biden indicted on nine tax charges, adding to gun charges in special counsel probe

articles.author: MICHAEL R. SISAK and MICHAEL BALSAMO
articles.description: Derek Chauvin was stabbed nearly two dozen times in the law library at a federal prison in Arizona.
articles.title: High-profile attacks on Derek Chauvin and Larry Nassar put spotlight on violence in federal prisons

articles.author: JILL COLVIN and BILL BARROW
articles.description: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. (AP) — As Donald Trump faces growing scrutiny over his increasingly authoritarian and violent rhetoric, Fox News host Sean Hannity gave his longtime friend a chance to assure the American people that he wouldn't abuse power or seek retribution if he wins a second term.
articles.title: Trump's vow to only be a dictator on 'day one' follows growing worry over his authoritarian rhetoric

articles.author: RIO YAMAT and BEN FINLEY
articles.description: LAS VEGAS (AP) — A 67-year-old college professor who was denied jobs at various Nevada colleges and universities stuffed loaded handgun magazines into his waistband before walking into a University of Nevada, Las Vegas campus building and killing three faculty members, police said.
articles.title: UNLV gunman was unemployed professor who had 150 rounds of ammunition and a target list, police say

articles.author: EDNA TARIGAN
articles.description: BOGOR, Indonesia (AP) — At a lake in the West Javan city of Bogor, children and teenagers paddle toward piles of floating trash, pick it up and store it in their kayaks, before passing it to friends sorting it onshore.
articles.title: Indonesia's youth clean up trash from waterways, but more permanent solutions are still elusive

articles.author: JUAN A. LOZANO
articles.description: HOUSTON (AP) — A mayoral runoff Saturday between state Sen. John Whitmire, 74, and U.S. Rep. Sheila Jackson Lee, 73, has the fourth-largest city in the U.S. on the verge of picking a new leader who cuts against Houston's demographic trends.
articles.title: Houston has a population that's young. Its next mayor, set to be elected in a runoff, won't be
